alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:29PM CDT until March 31 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR WESTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHEASTERN BENTON...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN LINN AND EASTERN IOWA COUNTIES... At 529 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wildcat Bluff Park to near Riverside, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of western Johnson, southeastern Benton, northeastern Washington, southwestern Linn and eastern Iowa Counties, including the following locations... Middle Amana, South Amana, Frytown, Windham, Homestead, West Amana, Cou Falls, Upper South Amana, Cosgrove and East Amana. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. These are dangerous storms, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
